Tools

General purpose functions

Dataframe_to_latex(dataframe, sep=',')

A function to convert a pandas dataframe to a latex table. When running this function the output will be printed.

Parameters:

  • seperator – The dataframe that needs to be converted

  • seperator – The seperator the type used can be “.” or “,”.

Find_nearest(array, value)

A function to convert a pandas dataframe to a latex table. When running this function the output will be printed.

Parameters:

  • array – The array in which to search for a given value

  • value – The value to search for

Returns:

A tuple containing the value closest to the value and the index on where to find it.

Return type:

Tuple

Remove_ramp(signal, gues=None)

Function to remove a ramp from a signal. Signal must be a numpy array.

Parameters:

  • signal (float) – The signal that needs a ramp removed

  • gues (float) – geus for the ramp in the signal

Returns:

Signal without a ramp

Return type:

float

Smooth(signal, gues=None)

Function to smooth out a signal. Signal must be numpy array.

Parameters:

  • signal (float) – Signal to be smoothed

  • box_pts (float) – Smoothess of the curve

Returns:

Smoothed signal

Return type:

float

Error analysis and statistics

Error_function(function, variables)

Function to determine the error of a function based on the errros of the variables of that function.

Parameters:

function – A sympy expression of which the error function should be determined

Returns:

A sympy expression of the error function

Return type:

sympy.core.add.Add

Example:

from PToolkit import Error_function
import sympy as sy

I, R = sy.symbols("I, R")
V = I*R

error = Error_function(V, [I, R])

The outpur of the code:

\[\Delta V = \sqrt{\left|{I}\right|^{2} \left|{\Delta R}\right|^{2} + \left|{R}\right|^{2} \left|{\Delta I}\right|^{2}}\]
Round_sigfig(x, fig, type_rounding='Normal', format='numerical')

Function to determine the error of a function based on the errros of the variables of that function. This function also works with numpy arrays

Parameters:

  • x – A float that needs to be rounded

  • fig – The number of significant digits

  • type – The type of rounding: “Normal” rounds to the closest number, “Up” rounds up, “Down” rounds down

  • format – Unused param

Returns:

A number rounded to a n significant digits

Return type:

float

Chi_square_test(theorie, mean, error)

Function to perform a Chi^2 test

Parameters:

  • theorie (float) – Theoretical value of a data point

  • mean (float) – The mean of that data point

  • error (float) – The error of that data point

Chi_square_dist(x, d)

Function to calculate the values on a Chi^2 distribution

Parameters:

  • x (float) – The Chi^2 value

  • d (int) – Degrees of freedom

Returns:

The value at a given point in the Chi^2 distribution

Return type:

float

Calculate_degrees_of_freedom(n, v)

Function to calculte the number of degrees of freedom

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Amount of independent data points

  • v (int) – Amount of parameters

Returns:

Degrees of freedom

Return type:

int

Calculate_p_value(chi, d)

Function to calculate the p value of a Chi^2 distribution

Parameters:

  • chi (float) – The value found for chi^2

  • d (int) – Degrees of freedom

Returns:

p value

Return type:

float
